title: Define Project Requirements
description:
Gather and document the detailed requirements for the DataPageSeeker project, including the following key aspects:

1. Data Sources: Identify the specific purpose-built databases and their schemas that will be used as data sources for the application.

2. Search Functionality: Define the search criteria and filters that users will be able to apply to the data, such as keyword search, date range, and any other relevant filters.

3. Pagination: Specify the requirements for paginating the search results, including the number of items per page, navigation controls, and any other relevant pagination features.

4. Data Transformation: Outline the necessary data transformations or aggregations that need to be performed on the data before presenting it to the user.

5. User Interface: Describe the desired user interface for the searchable, paginated list, including the layout, design, and any specific UI/UX requirements.

6. Performance and Scalability: Identify any specific performance and scalability requirements, such as expected data volumes, concurrent user loads, and any other relevant factors.

7. Security and Access Control: Define any security and access control requirements, such as user authentication, data encryption, and role-based access controls.

8. Integrations: Identify any external systems or APIs that need to be integrated with the application.

9. Reporting and Analytics: Specify any reporting or analytics requirements, such as generating reports or visualizations based on the search results.

10. Testing and Quality Assurance: Outline the testing and quality assurance requirements, including unit testing, integration testing, and any other relevant testing strategies.

title: Design System Architecture
description: Design the overall system architecture, including the data flow, components, their interactions, and the technologies to be used. Consider the following aspects: data ingestion, storage, processing, querying, caching, search indexing, pagination, and user interface.

title: Set up Development Environment
description: Set up the development environment, including the necessary tools, frameworks, and libraries.

title: Implement Backend
description: Implement the backend components, including the database connections, data transformations, and API endpoints.

title: Implement Frontend
description: Implement the frontend components, including the user interface, search functionality, and pagination.

title: Write Documentation
description: Write comprehensive documentation for the project, including installation instructions, API documentation, and user guides.

title: Perform Testing
description: Develop and execute test cases to ensure the application meets the requirements and functions as expected.

title: Conduct Security Audit
description: Perform a security audit to identify and mitigate potential vulnerabilities in the application.

title: Deploy to Production
description: Deploy the application to the production environment, including any necessary configuration and setup.
